creator: kgrey@dynamicsoft.com
text:
Mail task doesn't allow you to set arbitrary headers.  For example, a message sent using it does 
not set a "Date" header by default.  As a result, lacking mail clients like Outlook do not properly 
report the "Sent" date (it shows up as "None" in the message).  This causes the build maintainer to 
get many a disgruntled emails from many architects about it not showing up properly in his 
"Thread" view of his Inbox.

A good solution would be to add a sub element "header" with 
name/value contents.  To solve this specific problem, the user would just need to set the "Date" 
header with the current time when sending the message.

message.addHeader("Date", (new 
Date()).toString());  Would suffice.

If you have a patch for this, plus docs and a test we will consider it. 
However is must be against the current CVS version, as Mail/MimeMail has been 
much reworked since 1.4
creator: steve_l@iseran.com
kgrey@dynamicsoft.com
text:
Created attachment 1670
Patch for files MimeMailer.java and PlainMailer.java

I've attached a patch for MimeMailer and PlainMailer classes which adds the "Date" header to the 
email.  This solves the problem of the send Date not showing up in various mail clients 
appropriately (Mozilla, Outlook).
